question: Match the following:
columnA: Gelatinous coating on brown algal cell wall
Attachment of plant body in brown algae
Shape of gametes in brown algae

question: Match the following:
columnB: Ectocarpus, Dictyota, Laminaria, Sargassum and Fucus
Biflagellate zoospores that are pear-shaped and have two unequal laterally attached flagella
May be isogamous, anisogamous or oogamous

answer.Brown algae asexual reproduction: Biflagellate zoospores that are pear-shaped and have two unequal laterally attached flagella
answer.Brown algae sexual reproduction: May be isogamous, anisogamous or oogamous
answer.Common brown algae: Ectocarpus, Dictyota, Laminaria, Sargassum and Fucus

question: Match the following:
columnB: Marine with greater concentrations found in the warmer areas
Multicellular; some have complex body organisation

answer.Habitat concentration of red algae: Marine with greater concentrations found in the warmer areas
answer.Structure of red thalli: Multicellular; some have complex body organisation

question: Match the following:
columnB: Oogamous and accompanied by complex post fertilisation developments

answer.Red algae sexual reproduction: Oogamous and accompanied by complex post fertilisation developments

question: Match the following (Table 3.1 - Algae Classes):
columnB: Fresh water (some), brackish water, salt water (most)

answer.Rhodophyceae habitat: Fresh water (some), brackish water, salt water (most)
